item.title: Introduction to Cloud Computing Architecture
item.description:
Cloud computing is the delivery of compute and storage resources on-demand.

It offers these benefits compared to own cluster management:

  • Performance
  • Cost efficiency
  • Elasticity (ability to scale) like Cloud Storage S3.
  • Availability (difficult to lose files in the cloud, because of the automatic backup measures).

So we don’t need to

  • Have land
  • Buy hardware
  • Manage software versions, updates, failures etc.

it is basically like renting.

It is very common to have a single resource as the bottleneck, so much of the hardware just sits there idling.
